title: Tokay High students dream big
content: Dressed in purple caps and gowns, some of them with gold cords or stoles, 434 students from the Tokay High School Class of 2018 filed into University of the Pacific’s Alex G. Spanos Center in Stockton on Friday evening, waiving to friends and family who cheered in the stands as “Pomp and Circumstance” rang out through the stadium.    Principal Erik Sandstrom told the students to remember looking forward to the end of the school day, the week, the school year and their own graduation before saying that they must now look even further into the future.
